Description: Lower body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery heavy chalice with handle root; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black with two added white bands; exterior: surface mostly lost; from top, part of undetermined decoration, possibly filling ornament; below, part of frill pattern around handle; to right, trace of guilloche pattern above brown band.
Curator's comments: Given the limited amount of decoration on the sherd's interior, perhaps this sherd ought to be placed in the early phases of the Mature Animal Style. For parallels regarding the floral pattern on the lower body, see Lemos 1991, no. 114 from Emporio.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1530) (phase 2)
